result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard T McBeath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court waived the DNA surcharge as a DNA sample was not taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Restitution to be determined at a hearing on 7/22/15 at 8:30 am.                                          -

09-01-15/ Rebecca Dallet                        -
The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $211.92, payable to Melanie M., to  be paid by 03-01-17.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive. Stayed pending a review on 9-25-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard T McBeath

Reflects 09-01-15 Court order for restitution to Melanie M

Defendant Richard T McBeath in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Richard T McBeath in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Restitution hearing held.  Melanie M. appeared via telephone.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $211.92 payable to Melanie M., to be paid by 03/01/2017.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Richard T McBeath not in court, defendant in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for restitution hearing.  Defendant was not produced again and counsel does not know if the defendant agrees to the amount requested.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  State to do an Order to Produce.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Richard T McBeath not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for restitution hearing.  Defendant not produced and counsel just received the information and needs to review it with the defendant.  Court waived the 60 day time limit for restitution hearing for cause.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant produced.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard T McBeath in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Richard T McBeath in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 21 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days consecutive in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as a DNA sample was not taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution to be determined at a hearing on 7/22/15 at 8:30 am.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Same conditions to apply.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Richard T McBeath not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $500.00.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Melanie M

Defendant Richard T McBeath in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Richard T McBeath in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
